creditline: Gift of Remak Ramsay, Class of 1958
inscribed: Inscribed, on verso lower right: The Riviera
signed: Stamped signature in ink, on mount lower right: Arthur B. Davies

texts.textentryhtml: Best known for his symbolist-inspired Arcadian landscapes, the painter and designer Arthur B. Davies was also the prime mover of the Armory Show of 1913, which introduced American audiences to a selective sampling of modernist art. This lyrical watercolor of specific French settings date from late in Davies’s career, when he traveled frequently to southern Europe for health reasons. Like most of his watercolors from this period, this is composed over colored paper, which intensifies the cool effects of the overcast sky in the beach scene.
texts.remarks: Painting on Paper: American Watercolors at Princeton

texts.textentryhtml: Sale, Christie's, March 10, 1989, lot 279 [handwritten note on card: "sold for $2,400"] (See reference Bib. 5194);
